summary:
Experienced in Transaction Banking, Trade Finance Sales, Business Development, Financial Crime Compliance Advisory, Sanctions, Financial & Non-Financial Risk, Multinational Corporate and Institutional Banking. 

Financial Services Professional with a Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) degree in Mathematics Engineering from Istanbul Technical University (ITU) with one academic year as an exchange student in Durham University, UK. As an individual, have an outstanding work ethic, strategic vision, good eyes for detail and strong aspiration to learn and deliver.  

Aim to reach a leadership role with impact in global corporate and investment banking in Western Europe or Northern America.

school.name: Isparta Süleyman Demirel Fen Lisesi / Isparta Suleyman Demirel Science High School

awards.title: Runner Up as a Team in Kingston University Entrepreneurship Competition on 14 May 2011, Istanbul Turkey
awards.description: On 14th of May 2011, I attended Kingston University's Entrepreneurship Competition and I was matched with few other people where we formed a team and produced a business idea and plan throughout the day and closed the day with being runner-up as a team in the competition.

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the Country COO, have an oversight of strategic and digital transformation, strategy implementation across various client journeys. 

Being a conduct and governance lead within the bank, ensuring appropriate execution of regulatory projects (IBOR Transformation, The Bank Data Retrieval Portal (BDRP)), regulatory reporting (such as DAC6, PSD2 Fraud Reporting), complaints & conduct management, product governance and pricing, conflicts of interest, information control & market abuse processes in the country while changing and simplifying the underlying tools and implementing respective procedures. 

Analyse various customer feedback, address any issues to improve customer experience and report the outcomes to relevant governance committees 

Provide proactive and robust oversight on financial and non-financial risks that impacts multiple CEO Scorecards, reviewing various processes, risks and controls for optimization while chairing or participating in various financial and non-financial risk related local, regional and off-shore governance meetings and establishing effective governance mechanisms for decision making and for appropriate escalation 

Act as Sustainability & Sustainable Finance Ambassador for HSBC, The Netherlands to embed group’s sustainability agenda with various internal and client initiatives
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Office, Wholesale Banking

profile_positions.description:
Joined the Sanctions Team as an Assistant Manager in March 2016 with accountability for meeting legislative and regulatory requirements in Trade, Economic and Financial Sanctions (Inc. sanctions programs administered by the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control, United Nations and HM Treasury’s Financial Sanctions) and was promoted to Manager Role in May 2018. 

Closely worked with Retail Banking & Wealth Management (RBWM), Commercial Banking (CMB), Global Banking and Markets (GBM) Businesses and various product groups in order to implement Sanctions Policy & Procedures in the country, identify sanctions risks and training needs, provide strategic support for various initiatives and increase robustness of bank’s financial crime risk culture. 

Provided subject matter expert guidance to RBWM, CMB, GBM segments on executing complex deals, reviewed new and existing customers’ sanctions risk profiles through remediation projects, periodic reviews and strategically advised the business on setting-up necessary risk mitigating controls

Managed the overall enterprise level HSBC Sanctions Programme and on behalf of Country Head of Sanctions including resource planning and governance of country sanctions team

Executed the Sanctions Operational Effectiveness Transformation Program which aims to reach the future state of Sanctions Department from screening, non-screening controls to alert management, MI and governance
profile_positions.title: Financial Crime Compliance, Sanctions Manager

profile_positions.description:
Joined the bank as a management trainee in its Trade & Supply Chain Department right after university graduation and attained fast-track continuous increase in responsibility by obtaining my own portfolio after 1 year experience in 2012 while working under Senior Portfolio Manager. In 2014, the department evolved into Global Trade and Receivables Finance and I became solely responsible for all Global Banking Customer Segment and became Sales Assistant Manager. 

Responsible for Global Banking Clients segment, making visits to multinational corporates and institutions to introduce bank’s trade and receivables finance capabilities and analyze their trade cycles, needs and prepare tailor made solutions to them. 

Manage key accounts, maintain long term relationships with accounts and maximise sales opportunities with them while acting as the key interface between the customer and all relevant divisions. 

Structured various transactions for different sectors: supplier finance project for TMT (Telecommunication, Media, Technology) sector, custom bonds for FIs, pre-shipment export finance for Iron &Steel sector, bank avalised draft discounting for Industrials sector.

Worked with marketing team to prepare customer workshops, country specific international trade and business events such as RMB Road Show in 2013 and press releases focused on international trade and to develop relationship with trade organizations, councils and chambers of commerce
profile_positions.title: Global Trade and Receivables Finance, Sales & Business Development Assistant Manager

profile_positions.description: Participated in Istanbul Stock Exchange's (now named as Borsa Istanbul) 2-week Practical Student Training Program (PSTP) designed for university undergraduate students. The program offered detailed information about the Turkish Capital Markets and Operations of Istanbul Stock Exchange's markets for 3rd and 4th year undergraduate students who will be in professional work life in near future.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description: Veripark is a software house spacialized in providing multichannel delivery, customer reationship management and loan origination solutions to financial institutions. Participated in company's Training School which provides solid baseline training on leading technologies combined with hands - on experience in real-life projects to students.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Akkardan is the leading supplier of propeller shafts and steering columns in Turkey with 30 years in experience in manufacture and design of these products for the light and  heavy commercial vehicles made by Ford Otosan, Mercedes -Benz Turk, Otokar (Magirius, Land Rover), Otoyol (Iveco), Anadolu Isuzu , Aksam, BMC, Temsa (Mitsubishi).

As an intern, assisted Akkardan’s daily business at IT department and prepared databases via Microsoft Access. Made rotation to procurement, sales, planning, finance departments and observed and assisted company's day to day operations.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Istanbul Technical University is identified with engineering and architecture education in Turkey along with its 239-year long bright history, modern education environment and strong academic staff. With its highly evolved campus life, ITU prepares the students for the future.

Participant of the June - July 2008 internship programme (organized by Academicians of ITU Mathematics Engineering Department) to learn “Technical Analysis at Stock Exchange” by using a special software programme called Matriks
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer for More Than Money Programme

company.name: Genç Başarı Eğitim Vakfı - Junior Achievement Türkiye

volunteer_experiences.description: I was a volunteer at HSBC Group’s Junior Achievement (JA) More than Money Program in Turkey from March 2012 to March 2014. The volunteers consisted of HSBC Employees and as a volunteer, I taught the basic notions such as the role of money in society, being a smart customer and setting up a business to earn money to elementary school students under the program.

The Educational Volunteers Foundation of Turkey (TEGV) is one of the most well-known NGOs in education area in Turkey aiming to support primary education provided by the government. As an activity volunteer, I had the chance to lead activities like math & science, computer literacy, art in one of the learning units of TEGV.

Lunaria is a nonprofit organization, secular, independent and autonomous by the parties founded in 1992 in Italy. It promotes peace, social and economic justice, equality and guarantee of citizenship rights, democracy and participation from below, social inclusion and intercultural dialogue. International mobility and voluntary work, youth policies, migration and the fight against racism, analysis of public budget, economic and social policies, sustainable development, the fight against inequality, are at the center of its social commitment. (https://www.lunaria.org/english/)
As an international volunteer, I worked with 6 volunteers from 6 different nationalities to conduct a music festival named Arts On Air in Torre Pellice, Turin, Italy.
